ratings.comment: Music 103 is easy as long as you show up to class. All of the information that you need to know is in the lecture. The grading is a bit tricky, because some of it is arbitrary, but I never had too hard of a time. I don't understand a lot of these other reviews saying she is awful, because that was not my experience at all.
lack of expectations and communication. did not follow the syllabus. very difficult to understand grading criteria...
This one should not be an educator!

Something like that should not be an educator/instructor.

You have no idea when you are wrong or right.
She's awesome. I did take a few music classes before but don't expect to have to do much homework at all, just pay attention in lectures and you will be just fine.

She was easy to understand, and her lectures were available over Zoom which was really nice if I couldn't make it in for whatever reason. The class would be slightly difficult if you had little to no musical background knowledge, but if you've taken any music class in your life, you'll be just fine!

I regret taking this class. Doc Mok is clearly passionate about music, and expects her students to be just as passionate. Her tests are way too specific for a gen ed music class. I did more homework and essays for music 103 than classes for my actual major. This class was way too detailed and way too much work for what it is. Don't waste your time.
